cleaned_text: okay so lots to unpack here firstly separate logical thinking and problem solving these are different mental skills problem solving usually involves discipline to stick to a problem definition approach the intelligence to find the insights that render the problem solvable the wisdom to separate the important insights from the noise and the creativity divergent thinking to evaluate multiple solutions logical thinking per the traditions of formal logic are more about proper processing of evidence and assumptions while remaining cognizant of and attempting to avoid the logical fallacies that constantly lay in wait to trip humans up i am a deeply logical human and formally trained in analytical philosophy and this is not something that most people want and appreciate practically in the real world the most logical person you know is either a terrible pedant or a misanthrope so lets stick with problem solving what you would want to do is identify how many meaningful questions a person could ask in response to a problem how they might go about attempting to develop learning against those questions and the quantity of possible solutions pathways they would consider you could pick a handful of thorny problems and write approaches to each and in ancient times the first step in being a genius was to be independently wealthy otherwise you were never educated possibly illiterate and toiled when you were wealthy you now had to decide whether to focus on the affairs of the day or on the theoretical learning it is the theoretical learning that survives with a name attached but know that some human devised and designed the roman aqueducts we dont know who but they were every bit the genius of the theoretical scholars on this sub i imagine youll find more aqueduct builders than nobel prize winners

cleaned_text: hello ive asked gemini heres the framework that it gave to me urban farms cultivating freshness in the city problem growing populations and urban sprawl are putting pressure on traditional agricultural land leading to increased food insecurity difficulty accessing fresh healthy produce especially in underserved communities environmental concerns longdistance transportation of food contributes to greenhouse gas emissions and fuel dependence disconnection from food sources lack of understanding about where food comes from and how its grown solution urban farms offer a innovative approach to food production by utilizing vacant land or underused spaces within city limits for growing fresh sustainable produce this concept encompasses various methods including rooftop gardens utilizing rooftops of buildings for growing vegetables fruits and herbs vertical farming stacking growing layers to maximize space and resource efficiency community gardens creating shared spaces for residents to grow their own food and foster social connections aquaponics combining aquaculture fish farming with hydroponics growing plants without soil in a closed system benefits increased access to fresh healthy food urban farms provide local communities with readily available highquality produce addressing food insecurity concerns reduced environmental impact shorter transportation distances decrease carbon footprint and reliance on fossil fuels enhanced community development urban farms can become vibrant community hubs promoting social interaction education and green spaces within cities improved public health increased access to fresh produce encourages healthier eating habits and combats dietrelated illnesses target market urban residents seeking access to fresh local produce restaurants and businesses aiming for sustainable sourcing community organizations promoting healthy eating and social engagement individuals interested in learning about and participating in urban agriculture marketing strategy partner with local businesses and restaurants to showcase the farms produce organize educational workshops and tours to raise awareness about urban farming benefits utilize social media platforms to connect with the community and share the farms story collaborate with schools and community centers to integrate urban farming into educational programs by establishing urban farms you can address critical issues related to food access sustainability and community development while offering a unique and impactful business opportunity note this is just a starting point and you can further develop this concept by including details about specific type of urban farm you envision rooftop vertical etc target crops and production methods business model and revenue streams community engagement initiatives potential challenges and mitigation strategies remember a strong business plan requires thorough research competitor analysis and financial projections this framework provides a foundation for you to build upon and create a compelling solution for your assignment
label: r/innovation

cleaned_text: while i think this is true for the most part i think christensen is looking at a larger phenomenon through the keyhole of innovation there is a championchallenger dynamic at play the current champion has the winning formula for the current market to remain the champion they need to derive the winning formula for the future market there are usually very few champions and they are usually large and powerful in their domains meanwhile there is a much larger number of challengers who are pursuing a variety of strategies where the champions are uniform in their fitness to the current market challengers are diverse as the environment shifts pure dumb luck can make a challenger into a champion sticking with christensens obsession with the chip market consider intel and nvidia nvidia was a bit player pun intended until first bitcoin mining and now generative ai have sent demand for their chips to the stratosphere it wasnt brilliant innovation on nvidias part or a failure to innovate on intels part but a change in the customer needs that is driving the differential performance while i am a professor innovator its how i pay the rent i often see the market forces more in terms of biology natural selection and evolutionary forces specifically the slow lamarckian adaptation of existing firms and the periodic often seemingly spontaneous growth of nascent firms i then see the executives issue as less of an innovators dilemma and more of a diversification dilemma business leaders should invest their profits in competitors and competing technologies
label: r/innovation
